subSections.text: {{zh-forms|alt=畾,𡈶,𩇓-ancient,𤴐-ancient,𩂩-ancient,𤳳-ancient,䨓-ancient,𩄣-ancient,靁-ancient,㗊-ancient,𤴑-ancient}}

subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
Ancient simplification of {{och-l|靁}}, which was a {{Han compound|雨|畾|ls=psc|c1=s|t1=rain|c2=p|nocap=1}}.

subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text: {{ja-kanji|grade=c|rs=雨05}}

subSections.title: Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}} {{wikipedia|Thunder}} {{wikipedia|Lightning}} [[File:Lightning over Oradea Romania 3.jpg|thumb|right|250px|{{lang|ja|雷}} (''kaminari'', ''kannari'', ''ikazuchi'', ''narukami'', ''rai''): '''[[thunder]]''' and '''[[lightning]]'''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かみなり}} Compound of {{compound|ja|sort=かみなり|神|tr1=kami|t1=god, spirit|鳴り|tr2=nari|t2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|鳴る}} ''naru'', “to cry out, to call”}}.{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}{{R:Daijirin}}

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|かみなり|acc=3|acc_ref=NHK,DJR|acc2=4|acc2_ref=NHK,DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: This ''kaminari'' reading is the most common reading when used as a standalone noun.

subSections.title: Synonyms
Idioms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|雷が落ちる|かみなり が おちる}}: “the thunder comes down” → to be [[scolded]] severely by a superior, to be [[ripped]] a new one

subSections.title: Etymology 2
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|かんなり}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|雷鳴り}}, {{ja-l|雷鳴}}

subSections.title: Noun
Proper noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|proper|かんなり}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かんなり|rare|archaic}} short for {{m|ja|雷の壺|tr=Kaminari no Tsubo|lit=thunder pot}}, one of the five buildings in the imperial palace in ancient {{m|ja|平安京|tr=Heian Kyō||[[w:Heian-kyō|Heian-kyō]]|pos=modern-day [[w:Kyoto|Kyōto]]}}

subSections.title: Etymology 3
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|いかずち}}

subSections.title: Noun
Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|なるかみ}}
Compound of {{compound|ja|sort=なるかみ|鳴る|tr1=naru|t1=to cry out, to call|神|tr2=kami|t2=god, spirit}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|なるかみ}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{ja-l|鳴る神}}, {{ja-l|鳴神}}

subSections.title: Noun
Proper noun
Etymology 5
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|らい}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=らい}} {{m|zh|雷|tr=luəi||thunder}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading '' léi'', {{etyl|yue|-}} ''leoi<sup>4</sup>''.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=goon|らい|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: Used more in compounds than on its own. As a standalone noun, the ''kaminari'' reading is the most common.
